alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 01 at 3:23AM MST until March 02 at 12:00AM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet and East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from midnight tonight to 8 PM MST Thursday. For the Wind Advisory, from 8 AM this morning to midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet
